p: The other microalgae species had low yield of carotenoids, but among the species evaluated, S. bibraianum ( Fig. 2) had the highest content of cryptoxanthin (1.34 mg g -1); Chlamydomonas planctogloea for canthaxanthin (1.49 mg g -1) and Mougeotia sp. for fucoxanthin (0.92 mg g -1). Lutein has a zeaxanthin isomer. The lutein spectrum was differentiated from its isomer by the intensity between the molecular protonated ion m/z 569 and the fragment m/z 551. For lutein, the m/z 551 fragment is more abundant than the protonated molecular ion m/z 569, whereas zeaxanthin exhibits the opposite profile ( Rivera et al., 2011).
